summary: Email chain from August 2019 between US Marshals and FBI discussing potential witnesses related to Jeffrey Epstein's activities in the Virgin Islands following his death. The emails reveal individuals who worked on Epstein's property or at the airport and may have information, including observations of underage girls, and mention international travel records.

persons.name: Vanessa
persons.context: Worked on Jeffrey Epstein's property for a week; her fianc√© recently quit; may help find more people who worked on the island.

persons.name: Pat
persons.role: Air Traffic Controller on St. Thomas
persons.context: Air Traffic Controller on St. Thomas who stated similar observations as Kim regarding Epstein and underage girls.

persons.name: Kim
persons.context: Worked as Air Traffic Control in Asheville, NC, and previously at St. Thomas from March 2018 to April 2019; reported seeing Epstein with underage girls disembarking from his jet and flying to his island.

persons.name: Anna
persons.context: A female named by Vanessa as someone who 'knows all JEs secrets'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; his death is noted as potentially making witnesses more willing to talk; his travel with underage girls and property ownership are discussed.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in the email chain, likely involved in the investigation.

connections.description: Vanessa worked on Epstein's property for a week.
Kim observed Epstein with underage girls at the airport during her work as an Air Traffic Controller.
Pat made similar observations as Kim regarding Epstein and underage girls.
Described as someone who 'knows all JEs secrets'.

events.title: Witness coordination after Epstein's death
events.description: US Marshal informs FBI that Vanessa is now more willing to talk following Epstein's death and the raid on his house, and coordinates for FBI to reach out to her and Pat.

events.title: Epstein's arrival in Austria
events.description: Austria confirmed that Jeffrey Epstein landed with three females, had coffee at The Coffee House Landmann, and then departed.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Referenced as 'Saturday happened', indicating Jeffrey Epstein's death, which occurred on August 10, 2019.

locations: Little St James (Epstein's private island in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: Witnesses who previously signed $1 million NDAs and were 'petrified to talk' may now be more willing to speak following Epstein's death and the raid on his property.

Air Traffic Controller Kim reported observing Jeffrey Epstein with underage girls disembarking from his jet and then flying via his helicopter to his private island during her tenure from March 2018 to April 2019.
Austrian authorities confirmed Epstein landed with three females on March 22, 2019, and visited a coffee shop before departing.
Epstein provided apartments on St. Thomas to his pilots under one of his company names, with locations near the airport.

The US Marshals Service notes they investigate 18 USC 2250 charges (failure to register as a sex offender) but rely on territorial compliance, and to their knowledge, had not accompanied territorial authorities on compliance checks for Epstein.
